protocol_name: Introducing dinoflagellate gene into diatom using gene gun
protocol_name_html: Introducing dinoflagellate gene into diatom using gene gun
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/i6cdspe.docx","file_id":"9090","thumb_url":"/img/extensions/docx.png","ofn":"Introducing dinoflagellate gene into diatom using gene gun.docx"}]
description: While dinoflagellate transformation tool is not yet ready, transforming dinoflagellate genes into a model alga such as a diatom is a viable option.
protocol_affiliation: University of Connecticut and Xiamen University

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors_list.name: Senjie Lin and Kaidian Zhang
authors_list.affiliation: University of Connecticut and Xiamen University

components.data: Collect Phaeodactylum tricornutum cells (2×108) from an exponentially growing liquid culture by centrifugation at 1,500x g for 10 min at 4℃ , then resuspend in 200 µL 50% seawater to a final density of 109 cells ml-1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect Phaeodactylum tricornutum cells (2×108) from an exponentially growing liquid culture by centrifugation at 1,500x g for 10 min at 4℃ , then resuspend in 200 µL 50% seawater to a final density of 109 cells ml-1.

components.data: Spread the cell suspension on 9 cm 1.5% agar plates containing 50% seawater supplemented with f/2 nutrients.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spread the cell suspension on 9 cm 1.5% agar plates containing 50% seawater supplemented with f/2 nutrients.

components.data: Prepare diatom cells on agar plate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Prepare diatom cells on agar plate

components.data: Carry out transformation using the Biolistic PDS-1000/He Particle Delivery System (Bio-Rad). M17 tungsten particles (Bio-Rad) are coated with DNA using 1.25M CaCl2 and 20mM spermidine. Use a burst pressure of 1550 psi and a vacuum of 28 Hg, and 3 µg of plasmid carrying a dinoflagellate rhodopsin gene.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carry out transformation using the Biolistic PDS-1000/He Particle Delivery System (Bio-Rad). M17 tungsten particles (Bio-Rad) are coated with DNA using 1.25M CaCl2 and 20mM spermidine. Use a burst pressure of 1550 psi and a vacuum of 28 Hg, and 3 µg of plasmid carrying a dinoflagellate rhodopsin gene.

components.data: The bombarded cells are incubated on the plate under low light (50 μmol photons m−2s−1) at 20℃ for a day.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The bombarded cells are incubated on the plate under low light (50 μmol photons m−2s−1) at 20℃ for a day.

components.data: Resuspend the cells in 600 µL sterile 50% seawater, and 200 µL of this suspension is plated onto solid medium containing 50 µg ml-1 Zeocin and KAS compound antibiotics, incubate under a 14 h light/10 h dark cycle (100 μmol photons m−2·s−1) at 20℃.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cells in 600 µL sterile 50% seawater, and 200 µL of this suspension is plated onto solid medium containing 50 µg ml-1 Zeocin and KAS compound antibiotics, incubate under a 14 h light/10 h dark cycle (100 μmol photons m−2·s−1) at 20℃.

components.data: After 3 weeks, re-streak colonies on fresh 9 cm 1% agar plates containing 75 µg ml-1 Zeocin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 3 weeks, re-streak colonies on fresh 9 cm 1% agar plates containing 75 µg ml-1 Zeocin.
